item.title: 鲍威尔手握美联储中枢，可能会在杰克逊霍尔选择一刀切的做法
item.description: 美国经济数据为美联储降息开了绿灯，金融市场也为首次降息行动做好了准备。周三，美联储7月份会议的报告显示，"绝大多数 "决策者同意宽松政策可能在下个月开始，这几乎宣告了美联储的降息行动已经开始。【原文：U.S. economic data is giving the Federal Reserve the green light to cut interest rates, financial markets are aligned for the first move, and the central bank all but gave the game away on Wednesday when a readout of its July meeting showed a "vast majority" of policymakers agreed the policy easing likely would begin next month.】

item.title: 加拿大车队工会称加拿大国家铁路公司工人将于周五返回工作岗位
item.description: 加拿大卡车司机工会（Teamsters Canada）表示，加拿大国家铁路公司（Canadian National Railway）工人的停工期结束后，将于周五返回工作岗位。【原文：Workers at Canadian National Railway will return to work on Friday, the Teamsters Canada union said, after their lockout at the company ended.】

item.title: 欧洲 日本央行上田支持日元。下一步，鲍威尔
item.description: Stella Qiu 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Stella Qiu】

item.title: 中国机器人制造商追赶特斯拉，以提供仿人工人
item.description: 中国主导着电动汽车市场。现在，中国正在追赶特斯拉，竞相制造由电池驱动的人形机器人，以取代在装配线上制造电动汽车的人类工人。【原文：China dominates the market for electric vehicles. Now it's chasing Tesla in the race to build battery-powered humanoids expected to replace human workers building EVs on assembly lines.】

item.title: 东京 8 月通胀率保持不变，结束了连续 3 个月的加速趋势
item.description: 路透社的一项民意调查显示，8月份日本首都东京的消费价格通胀率预计将保持不变，结束连续三个月的加速增长，这表明日本央行可能不会急于加息。【原文：Consumer price inflation is expected to stay unchanged in Japan's capital Tokyo in August, ending three months of acceleration, a Reuters poll showed, suggesting the central bank may not be in a rush to hike rates.】

item.title: 新加坡银行认为中东在 3 至 5 年内将占资产总额的五分之一
item.description: 新加坡银行（Bank of Singapore）高层表示，该行的目标是在未来三到五年内发展中东地区的业务，使该地区在其整体收入和私人银行资产中所占的比例从目前的 10%左右提高到 20%。【原文：Bank of Singapore aims to grow its business in the Middle East with the region contributing up to 20% of its overall revenue and private banking assets over the next three to five years from around 10% currently, its top executive said.】

item.title: 通过云计算获取美国限制技术的中国实体名单
item.description: 最近的公开招标文件显示，与国家有关的中国实体正在使用亚马逊或其竞争对手提供的云服务，以获取他们无法以其他方式获得的先进美国芯片和人工智能能力。【原文：State-linked Chinese entities are using cloud services provided by Amazon or its rivals to access advanced U.S. chips and artificial intelligence capabilities that they cannot acquire otherwise, recent public tender documents showed.】

item.title: 独家报道：中国实体转向亚马逊云及其竞争对手，以获取美国高端芯片和人工智能
item.description: 最近的公开招标文件显示，与国家有关的中国实体正在使用亚马逊或其竞争对手提供的云服务，以获取他们无法以其他方式获得的先进美国芯片和人工智能能力。【原文：State-linked Chinese entities are using cloud services provided by Amazon or its rivals to access advanced U.S. chips and artificial intelligence capabilities that they cannot acquire otherwise, recent public tender documents showed.】

item.title: 阿里巴巴将升级香港上市，以吸引中国投资
item.description: 中国电子商务巨头阿里巴巴周五表示，该公司股东已批准将其在香港的上市地位升级为主要上市地位的计划，此举有望吸引来自中国大陆的巨额投资。【原文：Shareholders of Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba have approved a plan to upgrade its Hong Kong listing to primary status, the company said on Friday, a move that is expected to attract huge investments from mainland China.】

item.title: 亚洲股市转向谨慎，鲍威尔成为焦点，日元因日本央行行长讲话而上涨
item.description: 由于投资者在全球最有权势的央行行长发表讲话前持谨慎态度，市场希望确认美国将于9月开始降息，因此周五亚洲股市表现低迷，美元则从一年低点反弹。【原文：Asian shares stuttered on Friday while the dollar rebounded from one-year lows as investors were cautious ahead of a speech by the world's most powerful central banker with markets looking for confirmation U.S. rate cuts would start in September.】

item.title: 鲍威尔讲话前美元持稳，上田旨在安抚市场情绪
item.description: 美元周五表现平静，交易员们在等待美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）的讲话，而日本央行（BOJ）行长上田一夫（Kazuo Ueda）则旨在安抚上个月意外加息后挥之不去的市场神经。【原文：The U.S. dollar was calm on Friday as traders braced for comments from Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, while Bank of Japan (BOJ) Governor Kazuo Ueda aimed to soothe lingering market nerves after a surprise rate hike last month.】

item.title: 本周油价将因需求担忧和供应缓解而走低
item.description: 周五亚市早盘，油价持稳，但由于美国就业数据下调引发需求担忧，以及加沙停火谈判缓解了对供应中断的担忧，油价有望在本周结束时走低。【原文：Oil prices were steady in early Asian trading on Friday, but were poised to end the week lower as downward revisions to U.S. employment data raised demand concerns and ceasefire talks in Gaza eased worries about supply disruptions.】

item.title: 日本 7 月核心通胀率回升，但需求驱动型增长低于 2
item.description: 周五的数据显示，日本 7 月份核心通胀率连续第三个月加速上升，但需求驱动的价格增长放缓可能会使央行未来几个月进一步加息的决定变得更加复杂。【原文：Japan's core inflation accelerated for a third straight month in July, data showed on Friday, but a slowdown in demand-driven price growth could complicate the central bank's decision on further interest hikes in coming months.】

item.title: 澳大利亚监管机构将澳新银行的附加资本要求提高至 5.02 亿美元
item.description: 澳大利亚审慎监管机构周五表示，已将贷款机构澳新银行集团的资本附加要求提高至7.5亿澳元（约合5.0273亿美元），反映出对该行非金融风险管理的担忧不断升级。【原文：Australian prudential regulator on Friday said it has increased the capital add-on requirement for lender ANZ Group to A$750 million ($502.73 million), reflecting escalating worries about the bank's management of non-financial risks.】

item.title: 早间竞价美元反击，日本成为焦点
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 哈里斯顾问迪斯呼吁制定清洁能源马歇尔计划
item.description: 美国副总统卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris）总统竞选团队的经济顾问布莱恩-迪斯（Brian Deese）周四呼吁制定一项经济计划，向盟国提供资金购买美国的绿色能源技术，作为应对气候变化的更广泛战略的一部分。【原文：Brian Deese, an economic adviser for Vice President Kamala Harris' presidential campaign, called on Thursday for an economic program to loan allies money to buy U.S. green energy technologies as part of a wider strategy intended to fight climate change.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，Skydance 要求派拉蒙停止与布朗夫曼谈判
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周四报道，Skydance Media 指控派拉蒙全球公司的特别董事委员会违反交易条款，延长了该公司与其他竞购者接触的时间。【原文：Skydance Media is accusing Paramount Global's special committee of directors of breaching the terms of its deal by extending the period of time when it can engage with other bidders, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 罗斯百货（Ross Stores）上调利润预期，第二季度业绩超预期，原因是需求稳定
item.description: 罗斯百货公司（Ross Stores）周四上调了 2024 财年的利润预期，并公布了高于华尔街预期的第二季度业绩，这主要得益于对折扣服装的需求以及运费成本的降低。【原文：Ross Stores on Thursday raised its fiscal 2024 profit forecast and posted second-quarter results above Wall Street estimates, benefiting from demand for its discounted apparel and easing freight costs.】

item.title: 通用汽车 Cruise 将在 Uber 平台上部署自动驾驶汽车
item.description: 优步（Uber）和通用汽车支持的 Cruise 公司周四表示，Cruise 将在优步的打车公司平台上部署其自动驾驶汽车，这是一项多年协议的一部分。【原文：Uber and General Motors-backed Cruise said on Thursday Cruise will deploy its autonomous vehicles on the ride-hailing company's platform as part of a multi-year deal.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，阿斯利康警告称将把英国疫苗生产转移到美国
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周四报道，阿斯利康公司警告称，由于与工党政府就削减该项目国家援助计划的谈判陷入僵局，该公司可能会将其疫苗生产基地从英国迁往美国。【原文：AstraZeneca has warned it could relocate its vaccine manufacturing site from the UK to the U.S. amid a deadlock in negotiations with the Labour government over plans to cut state aid promised to the project, the Financial Times reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国邮政寻求通过投递和其他变革在 10 年内节省 300 亿美元
item.description: 美国邮政服务公司（U.S. Postal Service）周四表示，该公司正致力于实施改革，预计在未来十年内将为该机构节省约 300 亿美元。【原文：The U.S. Postal Service said on Thursday it is aiming to implement changes that it estimates will save the agency roughly $30 billion over the next decade.】

item.title: 聚焦：福特的三排电动 "个人子弹头列车 "SUV为何会失控？
item.description: 去年，在密歇根州迪尔伯恩举行的投资者日上，福特汽车公司的高管们盛赞他们即将推出的三排电动 SUV，并称这款车将于 2025 年下线。【原文：At a packed investor day in Dearborn, Michigan, last year, Ford Motor executives lauded their forthcoming three-row electric SUV, which they said would be rolling off assembly lines in 2025.】

item.title: 百时美施贵宝支持的 Zenas 生物制药公司申请在美国上市
item.description: 周四提交的一份监管文件显示，百时美施贵宝支持的Zenas BioPharma公司已申请在美国上市，这表明投资者对新上市企业的胃口越来越大。【原文：Bristol-Myers Squibb-backed Zenas BioPharma has filed to go public in the United States, a regulatory filing showed on Thursday, underscoring improving investor appetite for new listings.】

item.title: ELFA 称，7 月份美国商业设备借款增长 13
item.description: 美国设备租赁与融资协会周四称，7 月份美国公司设备投资融资借款同比增长了 13%。【原文：U.S. companies increased borrowing to finance equipment investments by 13% in July compared with the previous year, the Equipment Leasing and Finance Association said on Thursday.】

item.title: Perplexity AI 将于第四季度在搜索平台上推出广告
item.description: 英伟达（Nvidia）和杰夫-贝索斯（Jeff Bezos）支持的Perplexity AI公司周四表示，计划在第四季度在其人工智能驱动的搜索平台上推出广告。【原文：Nvidia and Jeff Bezos-backed Perplexity AI said on Thursday that it plans to introduce advertising on its artificial intelligence-powered search platform by the fourth quarter.】

item.title: 智利科德尔科公司因尾矿坝违规可能面临 800 万美元罚款
item.description: 智利环境监管机构周四表示，已就智利北部 Ministro Hales 分部塔拉布雷尾矿坝的管理问题对国有铜业巨头 Codelco 公司提出两项指控。【原文：Chile's environmental regulator on Thursday said it filed two charges against state copper giant Codelco over the management of its Talabre tailings dam at its Ministro Hales division in northern Chile.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，Evolent Health 在收到收购意向后正在进行出售谈判
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士周四表示，Evolent Health 正在与私募股权公司和医疗保健服务提供商洽谈潜在的出售事宜，这一过程是在该公司收到收购意向后启动的。【原文：Evolent Health is in talks with private equity firms and healthcare services providers for a potential sale, in a process that kicked off after it received takeover interest, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.】

item.title: 柯林斯：美联储有 "清晰的路径 "在不衰退的情况下实现目标
item.description: 波士顿联储主席苏珊-柯林斯（Susan Collins）周四表示，相信美国央行能够在不引发经济衰退的情况下降低通胀，并表示支持下月开始降息。【原文：Boston Federal Reserve President Susan Collins on Thursday expressed confidence the U.S. central bank will be able to bring inflation down without triggering a recession, and signaled her support for starting interest rate cuts next month.】

item.title: 上诉法院裁定亚马逊必须面对华盛顿特区的反垄断诉讼
item.description: 华盛顿特区的一家上诉法院周四恢复了该地区对亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc）的诉讼，称其合理地声称这家在线零售商的定价政策非法扼杀了竞争。【原文：An appeals court in Washington, D.C. revived the district's lawsuit against Amazon.com Inc on Thursday, saying it plausibly claimed the online retailer's pricing policies illegally stifle competition.】

item.title: 彭博新闻社报道：CME 和标准普尔探讨出售合资企业 OSTTRA
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四援引知情人士的话报道，衍生品交易所 CME 集团和金融信息公司 S&P Global 正在权衡出售合资企业 OSTTRA 的事宜。【原文：Derivatives exchange CME Group and financial information company S&P Global are weighing a sale of joint venture OSTTRA, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.】
